result.execSummary:
The defendant Amani K Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 21 days were granted. Time Served.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are waived.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Amani K Sims in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   21 Days jail  (21 Days credit)  -  TIME SERVED -  

COSTS:  WAIVED &  DNA surcharge is waived

 **Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Amani K Sims appears by vidoeconference from Milwaukee County jail, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears in person on behalf of Defendant.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rumpf requests a plea and sentence date.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee County jail.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
